intro: Cacalia anisochaetodes, commonly known as the woolly cacalia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy, often glandular leaves that help it retain moisture in arid environments. Its flowers are typically blue to purple in color, with ray florets surrounding a central disc. Cacalia anisochaetodes is often found in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations.
